reviews.review: Решил освежить воспоминания о серии Half-Life перед выходом очередной части франшизы (ну наконец-то, чёрт побери). Всё-же эпизодическая модель оказалась неплохой идеей, жаль мы так и не увидели финал трилогии. В 2020 году играется на удивление неплохо, рекомендую!

Always shorter than I remember.

Episode One polishes some things HL2 got wrong. The main one being; NPC followers. Alyx is with you most of the way here but she is actually competent! She will mostly stay out of your way, and she will get out of your way quick if she does. If only your squad in the base game was remotely this good... Other than that, the game is more of the same. Which is good since "the same" is a classic. This time around I did the "One Free Bullet" achievement which made things a little more interesting and slightly padded the ultra short length. I'm not an achievement hunter on the regular, but after playing something so many times over 15yrs? It was actually a nice way to spice things up.

Fun, single sitting romp down memory lane.
Good gem

Half-Life 2 foi um jogo bem interessante de se jogar, trazendo novidades divertidas com o seu investimento em física, a exploração de um mundo decadente e um final que te deixa curioso por mais. Buscando saciar essa demanda, os Episódios 1 e 2 expandem ainda mais o universo da franquia. Mas e aí, como eles se saíram com isso? Como, em especial, se sai o Episódio 1?

Half-Life 2: Episode One começa exatamente de onde seu antecessor termina. Seu objetivo é escapar da Cidade 17 com vida, algo simples, mas que resgata a palpabilidade do primeiro Half-Life com maestria, tendo uma progressão narrativa melhor que HL2 e até polindo detalhes do jogo original.

Uma adição bem-vinda foi a Alyx como companion na maioria do jogo, tendo alguém para te acompanhar no silêncio ou quebrar o clima com um contraponto divertido, além de resgatar o que era legal de ver com os guardas e militares no primeiro jogo. Um artifício que enriqueceu a experiência e consolidou a personagem como uma companion extremamente carismática.

Seus puzzles são bem-colocados e divertidos, sua trilha sonora mantém o padrão Half-Life, gerando momentos icônicos, e sua atmosfera finalmente clica, graças a filosofia "não conte, mostre", resgatada do primeiro jogo. Uma experiência rápida e simples, sim, mas concentradíssima no que apresenta.

No fim do dia, Half-Life 2: Episode One é uma jóia. Ele pode ser curto e conciso, mas enriquece o universo criado pela Valve com carinho e cuidado. Uma experiência que me fez apreciar mais esse mundo distópico e preparando o terreno para algo ainda maior. Jogue sem medo.
Half Life 2 gibi efsane bir oyun 7 saatte bitti. Görevleri biraz zor gibi ama güzel bir oyun.

Breve capitolo piuttosto divertente per varie situazioni e espedienti di gameplay, forse caratterizzato fin troppo da corridoi stretti che collegano mini arene ma comunque interessante; se non altro, prosegue la storia di una storica saga videoludica. Merita provarlo anche solo per il buffo doppiaggio italiano.

Небольшой сюжетный наследник второй Халфы представляет из себя всё тот же геймплей без особых нововведений, но с улучшенными текстурками, напряжёнными хоррор-эпизодами в полной темноте против толп зомби на любой вкус и цвет и множеством монологов от Аликс, которая раскрывается за 4 часа прохождения Первого Эпизода больше, чем за 17 часов оригинальной игры, вплоть до откровенных намёков на чувства к Гордону, что заставляет сердечко любого геймера трепетать. Но, несмотря на приятную ностальгию во время игры, чувство того, что это единственная часть франшизы, которая не предлагает ничего нового ни для лора, ни для геймплея не отпускает до финальных титров.

I want to give this game thumbs up but I am mortified by the terrible, absolutely awful controller support. 

The controllers worked great on a console, no reason they shouldn't work great on PC.

It should speak volumes of Valve; who SHOULD have more pride in such work. 

EDIT:: So I just learned that the controller configuration for this game was plugged in from a (seemingly random) player recommendation; which in fact turned an otherwise glorious game into a brick...  

I'm flabbergasted that Valve would allow such a subtle (not obvious; I've had this game for years and have been annoyed by the controls) way for players to completely RUIN the game for other players...

Valve should take back control of their game and consider learning a lesson...

The only criticism I have with this is that it's short. It can be finished in under 4 hours. That being said, every single minute of this is badass, whether its making the Combine fly with the supercharged gravity gun or shotgunning headcrab infected citizens in a dilapidated hospital with Alyx by your side kicking just as much ass as you are. 10/10 would recommend.
cool

The sense of urgency, due to the collapse occurring, really instills a constant feeling of hecticness and chaos. Also, by having Alex as a more constant companion throughout the episode results in a feeling of greater togetherness, which I liked, rather than just playing as a solo problem solver. Gameplaywise, the variety of physics-based puzzles, weapon locating progression, and traversing an array of environmentally diverse areas within a cohesive-looking city is simply great. Overall, excellent episode and love the developer commentary bonus.

[h1][b]Review For The Game Half-Life: Episode One[/b][/h1]

The game's best quote:
[b]"Tell me, Dr. Freeman, if you can. You have destroyed so much. What is it, exactly, that you have created? Can you name even one thing? I thought not."[/b]

I expected more.

This game was more of a DLC than a game in my opinion. And a DLC is supposed to give something new
and refreshing, but there was almost nothing new in this instance. They didn't introduce any new characters or weapons.
They introduced the Zombine, but that's the only new enemy they introduced. The good things about this game is the same elements as in Half-Life 2. This game isn't bad, but it's not satisfying your expectations. If you expected improved gameplay,
you won't get satisfied. But if you play to delve deeper into the Half-Life lore, it's almost mandatory. I would recommend this game for the story, and not for its gameplay.

+ Great story.
+ Great characters.
+ Great physics.
+ Great A.I.
+ Great experience all around.
+ Great controls

- Doesn't introduce much.
- A bit disappointing.

[spoiler][b]7/10[/b] Good![/spoiler]
